Dialogue.Page: Yahaha, you found me! Oh, wait... wrong line...
Behold: Ernesto the Magic Talking Anglerfish!
Did you wanna ask me something? Make it quick, I'm not really supposed to be talking right now.

DialogueOption.Text: If you can't talk aren't you just Ernesto the Magic Anglerfish?

Dialogue.Page: Huh. I guess I am. Do I have to change my identity now? I can probably-
Whoops, I went over my word limit. It's been nice talking, Hatchling.
Uh...
That's gonna be it for today. I'll see you later, Hatchling.
Geswaldo? I haven't heard that name in years...
It all began 5 years ago. I was taking a midnight stroll with Geswaldo.
The alleys were dark and shadowed. It was hard to see much of anything.

DialogueOption.Text: Aren't you not supposed to talk or something?

Dialogue.Page: I suddenly felt a strange presence. A sort of pressure, like the walls were closing in on us.
Geswaldo felt it too. The tight alleyways suddenly felt much more sinister.
We decided to turn back the way we came. It was clear we were somewhere we weren't supposed to be.

DialogueOption.Text: This feels like breaking the rules.

Dialogue.Page: As we reteated back through the brick corridors, the darkness seemed to become more and more oppressive.
Panic began to enter our minds. We rounded corner after corner, searching for some escape from this endless maze.
Geswaldo was having trouble keeping up, but I kept running. When I glanced behind me, he was suddenly gone.

DialogueOption.Text: Alright, I think that's enough talking.

Dialogue.Page: I do not know what became of Geswaldo that night. But I know that in my heart there is a hole that will never be filled again.
Wait... I feel something. A pressure.
Is is time.
Time for me to leave this world. There are no words left for me to speak.
It has been nice knowing you, Hatchling. I hope to see you again in another world.
Farewell.
I am sorry, Hatchling. My words have all but been exhausted.
Farewell. I hope I will see you again in another world.
What? Oh, sorry. I got carried away there.
Anyways, I'll catch you later. I'm gonna go be silent for a while.
